title: Learn How SMART Technologies Equips Companies to Collaborate Naturally. Special Televised Feature on Worldwide Business with kathy ireland
text:
MMP (USA), Inc. 
LOS ANGELES -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- MMP (USA) announces a Worldwide Business with kathy ireland exclusive interview with SMART Technologies, a company providing natural collaboration technologies for the modern world that connect teams intuitively and empower people to work and learn together in instinctively easy ways. During the segment, Kathy Ireland interviewed key executives from SMART including its CEO, CTO and VP of Marketing. 
Jeff Lowe, VP of Marketing for SMART, commented on the state of collaboration in business, noting that, "Collaboration is actually the single most important skill in business today but complexity is the enemy. We have seen a flood of new collaboration technology in business over the last few years, but rarely do the elaborate meeting room tools make businesses more productive or collaborative. Instead, users want to work in ways that are natural and familiar to them. Products like SMART kapp and SMART kapp iQ have seen success because of they are so simple to install and intuitive to use.” 
Neil Gaydon, President & CEO of SMART added, “The [B2B technology] industry cannot continue to justify the prices being charged for complicated collaboration solutions when people simply aren’t using the existing technology in meeting rooms today. The consumerization of business technology is driving change across the industry, and SMART’s solutions are designed to be simple, natural, walk-up-and-use tools." 
Tune in to see SMART Technologies on Fox Business Network as sponsored programming on October 17 at 5:00pm ET. 
About Worldwide Business with kathy ireland 
Worldwide Business with kathy ireland is a weekly business television program featuring real-world insights from corporate executives from all over the globe. 
Worldwide Business with kathy ireland airs Sunday evenings throughout North America on Fox Business Network as part of their sponsored programming lineup and to over 50 countries throughout the world on Bloomberg International as part of their sponsored programming lineup.
